website_summaries.verdict: Top-of-the-line purification in a water bottle. A must-have for travelers, hikers, and survivalists.
pros: Easy to use: fill, press, drink
Removes harmful bacteria, protozoa, and viruses from water sources
Nifty design for a cup-like drinking experience unlike competing brands
cons: Pushing down the filter takes strength
Is not as light-weight as claimed

customer_reviews.title: As you can see in the picture we used our ...
customer_reviews.text: As you can see in the picture we used our grayl to filter our water on my last trek. The container in the middle of the picture with the yellow water is the one we filtered. The black container on the left is the grayl of course. The clear container on the right contains the water after we filtered it with the grayl. Lets just say we didn't get sick after filtering. Some questionable water sources were used during our trek, and the grayl made life that much easier. We didn't have to haul our water with us saving weight, time, and energy. Thanks Grayl! You guys made my 5night, 6 day trek that much easier.
customer_reviews.author: robert lushbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Fastest water filter out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best filter I have used. Not the lightest (for that Sawyer wins) but in terms of the easiest and fastest this winds hands down. Just pour in water to the fill line, insert the inner part with filter on the bottom, push down and clean water is inside ready to drink. Much much faster than a pump. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: THIRST NO MORE
customer_reviews.text: Although it looks like a fancy cup, it is actually a @$70 piece of equipment!! I love this thing. I can roll out on the kayak and forget my water bottle....BOOM, I got my Grayl, thirst no more!!! Highly recommend. If you are picking between Life Straw and Grayl; Go Grayl....trust me.
customer_reviews.author: Singer

customer_reviews.title: Leaks
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why so many people have given this product such a great review, but for me this bottle simply sucks. It leaks. It's a pain to dry. I've tried it a few times while traveling and the deal on the outer and inner top part isn't that secure. I wanted something to use at the airports and hotels (just to be on the safer side) but after the first use I can't even put this in my carryon. It leaked. I had it in my pocket upright and it still managed to leak all over.
customer_reviews.author: Jason K

customer_reviews.title: Fill, Press, & Drink
customer_reviews.text: After 7 years of car camping in state and national parks in the USA and campgrounds here and in Canada, I have just returned from my maiden 10 mile hike to camp and then return the next day. I purchased this one because it was highly recommended by the renowned Rob Greenfield. It is SOOOOOOO easy to use: fill, press, drink! My hiking colleague's water from the same canal was tea colored. The water through the Grayl was crystal clear! Not that color is a true indication but it most certainly made me feel better about drinking it. I also love the fact that there are no exterior parts to fiddle with.
customer_reviews.author: dreadeddancer

customer_reviews.title: so much regret
customer_reviews.text: not only was this expensive it doesnt take 15 sec to purify the water! i pour cold water up to the line and push the inner tube slowly while counting. water was pouring out on the sides and after getting the inner tube fully in there was only a 1/4 left of water inside the bottle. not only that but the water tasted bad. this bottle is a ripoff. I dont think i can return it since i used the filter already.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Refund or replacement possible?
customer_reviews.text: Hi GRAYL, I was very excited to purchase this for a month-long trip to Ecuador, Peru, and Bolivia. You had the best reviews, but unfortunately, the filter did not work at all. I got sick only twice on this trip, which I will chalk up to being very careful about food and water. However, both times I did get sick, it coincided with using this water bottle from a tap. I would love to try this again, but don't want to get sick! Is there any way you can send me a replacement bottle? I'm happy to send this one back, but I've missed the Amazon window because my trip went longer than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Great filter!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this filter for a trip to Italy. I was spending too much money on bottled water on vacations and decided to try this as an alternative. The package arrived timely but appeared damaged. There were scuffs on the bottle and I surmised it had been used and returned. I started the return process but then changed my mind. After a thorough cleaning, I tested it using my pool water. The filter worked. I was surprised by the taste. In Italy, I used tap water, street fountains and spring water. This filter produced a consistent clean taste and paid for itself in one 2-week trip. I highly recommend this filter.
customer_reviews.author: S.Amico

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Works great for traveling and getting clean water everywhere. Do not cover the cop with your hand when you are placing the sleeve/filter into the bottle. Makes it impossible to insert if you don't let the air escape. We bought 1 for the 4 of us and the other 3 had normal water bottles that we filled up with this bottle once we filtered it with this. We were satisfied during our 2 week trip.
customer_reviews.author: Owner

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous
customer_reviews.text: It is ridiculous how much effort you have to out in to filter the water. You have to push and it takes a long time to filter the water. The filter clogs up very quickly. EVEN with crystal clear water!!!!!! Its not worth it!!! AVOID THIS ITEM AT ALL COSTS!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary-Dove Brown

customer_reviews.title: Drinkless to drinkable
customer_reviews.text: Took iron rich water in northern Argentina and made it crystal clear time after time.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Returned it. I could NOT press down hard enough ...
customer_reviews.text: Returned it. I could NOT press down hard enough to start the filtering process.
customer_reviews.author: Kindl jojo 27 customerjojo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Water filter bottle - easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We just finished a 12 day trip to Peru and used these water bottles all the time. Even though we didn't stay in any shady hotels, we still weren't sure of the water quality. These bottles are super easy to use. After filtering your water you can use it to wash your face, brush your teeth or just drink. Two of our guides do the Inca trail treks and were very impressed with the filtering system of these bottles and said they were going to check into them for themselves. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: shoper

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. Works 2 times then fails.
customer_reviews.text: The bad reviews are correct. I was able to use the filter only 2 times with Cuban tap water before it failed. Water spurted out as I pressed down on the top. Tied to dry it out but after a day it still didn’t work. What’s the point if you are camping or on travel and can only use it 2 times before failure? I ended up having to purchase bottled water. For me, it was an expensive and unfortunate error. Yes, the 4-5 star reviews duped me! I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: CreedGirl

customer_reviews.title: Defective Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my trip to South Africa, Swaziland and Zimbabwe. I got back the Wednesday before last. It seemed to work ok the first few tries but then it started to leak out everywhere during and after filtering it. Filled it to line, pressed and water would go everywhere. Then I set the empty filter piece with cup on the counter to dry out and it mysteriously leaked everywhere even though there was no filtered water in the container. I was disappointed to find out I missed the return deadline by just a day or two when I came bk. 60$ in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: CLT

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly Convenient
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about this, due to price, but am also extremely skeptical about water sources (even the so-called filtered water in those toxic plastic bottles). However, it noticeably reduced my stress on my last trip, so I am now a believer. I did go ahead and purchase the blue tap water filters (25% of the cost of the default orange filters per refill, which makes them kind of a no-brainer). So pleased!
customer_reviews.author: ebreeze1

customer_reviews.title: Real capacity is much smaller
customer_reviews.text: The filter purifies well, but expires much quicker then prescribed. I went 7-10 times to 1 day trails throught like 6-8 months and it’s done. Too hard to press and water goes out of between outer and inner cups. Very disappointed as I the price was high enough to get good quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a trip to West Africa where filtered water was critical! This is not a functional product. If you buy this expect that you will not have filtered water. It is nearly impossible to open. And, it doesn't really work. Save yourself and your health. I thought the idea was brilliant, having used the straw style bottles in the past. Maybe if the concept were executed in stainless it wouldn't stick. But this just didn't work. Was a super waste of money and did not protect my health. I never leave reviews but feel compelled because if you buy this thinking that you will rely on it, you could wind up in a terrible situation.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Elle

customer_reviews.title: The Grayl at altitude
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using my Grayl daily (sometimes multiple times each day) for the last month. I LOVE it! I travel a lot for work and the peace of mind which comes from having safe water to drink is absolutely fantastic! One tip: keep your Grayl empty when boarding a plane - not just to pass through security at the airport. I learned the hard way that air pressure fluctuations as the plane changes altitude can cause the seals to leak. You can still use the Grayl to purify bottled water from the service cart once you reach cruise altitude- just make sure to consume it all before descending or you’ll likely have a mess.
customer_reviews.author: FRED M

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle for Hotel Travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bottle to use primarily for traveling. There are times I don’t have access to bottled water and end up drinking the tap water. Depending on where I’m at, that can be pretty gross. I have used this bottle now for several days drinking tap water and it removes any nasty flavor. It’s easy to use and doesn’t take up much room. My only tip is be sure to leave the lid ajar when pressing water through the filter. I tried to keep the lid closed and it was forcing water out the sides of the bottle instead of through the filter, it was a mess. Once I figured that out, it has been great.
customer_reviews.author: MLB__17

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price. You get what you paid for fits this product to a tee
customer_reviews.text: At first I was upset when my wife purchased this filter at nearly $80. Now though, after a two week trip to Vietnam, this item turned out to be a godsend! I would estimate that we filtered 50 plus gallons over the course of our memorable trip, none of which involved any tummy upsets. Thanks to this great well made filter, we were able to enjoy clean good tasting water without fear of getting ill. It is well made and does the job of filtering water as advertised. Well worth the $80 we spent on it and it will be ready for our next crazy adventure!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Survived India!
customer_reviews.text: First trip to India almost killed me (literally....not kidding).....wasn't doing it again without some type of water protection so after much research I chose this product....Granted, I wasn't scooping water out of the Ganges River for drinking or anything, but I did have a few times where I had to use it to filter water fountain drinking water, etc....happy to report the water tasted perfectly ok, clean, and I am alive and well to tell about it. No issues with leaking, it was easy to use. Won't ever be traveling without it again, that's for sure!
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Great travel purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We took this to China and Thailand with us...fortunately bottled water was available everywhere so we didn't have to use it most of the time, but I did end up using it in the hotel room for water to brush our teeth with and I did use it when we ran out of bottled water in our hotel room which was just perfect! You want to make sure that you unscrew the top most of the way or maybe even remove it when you're pressing down so that you're not also fighting the pressure of the air in the bottle when you press down. My husband is going to be taking his on a road trip to Central America!
customer_reviews.author: Pandalu

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, Great for hiking Near Water Sources
customer_reviews.text: I carry this along with a water pouch when I hike. This filter bottle is a backup to my carried water. I've tried it once with water from a mountain stream. I did not get sick even though signs at the trailhead warned of contaminants in the water. Seems the filter did it's job. The water didn't taste great. I don't know how bad the unfiltered source water tastes so I can't really judge how much the filter improved it. If I had to drink that same water filtered by this bottle to survive, the less than ideal water taste would not be an issue. I'm very happy with the purchase both for recreation and potential emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Jim W.

customer_reviews.title: Performed great in the field
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe is that I wish it had a way to drink though the lid. That would also allow for airflow when pressing the water through the filter. You have to crack the screw tight lid a half turn to allow air in. If you want to take a swig of water while driving you have to remove the whole lid. The plus side is that it doesn’t leak when the lid is on.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cretella

customer_reviews.title: Great travel filter
customer_reviews.text: Used for 30 days in Costa Rica vacation, kept us from any stomach problems, taking to Mexico next, wish I had it on the 24 day cruise we recently took, 24 days of filling our water bottles from the bathroom faucet which had a notible after taste would have been removed with this product
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Clean water for the breathing machine
customer_reviews.text: Well made. I use the filter to produce water for my CPAP (continuous pressure breathing machine). No more lugging gallons of distilled water from the store. I've been doing this for a year. The only complaint is that it is difficult to see how much water to fill.... the fill line is not so visible to me. Oh, and it also packs well in the luggage to take on travels with the CPAP machine, so also no searching hotels for distilled water.
customer_reviews.author: Bert

customer_reviews.title: No need to suck the water through the filter.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it purifies the water without having to suck it out. Key part of instructions is turn the cap loose half way then push down on the filter portion of bottle. It's quick and easy despite hard to push down for water to pass through the filter. This should work beautifully for camping and traveling.
customer_reviews.author: glance

customer_reviews.title: Great filter!
customer_reviews.text: Lived on the motorcycle, camping, for six months, and this filter outperformed my expectations. I purchased the filter, and a replacement, to take with me on the trip. I used it nearly everyday, several times a day, and I never had a problem. Most of the time I was in the deeper woods, but even when closer to cities, this was great for removing the pool-water taste from municipal water. Using the filter was faster than my old method, and easier.
customer_reviews.author: Warrior Nomad

customer_reviews.title: Building up them guns  💪🏻
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work but you really need to apply some muscle to push this bottle down to filter the water. Just be prepared for it to be a slow filtering process or apply some serious strength. Ultimately it at least requires a bit of both.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great filter!! No plastic water bottles!
customer_reviews.text: We used this filter on our two week trip to Cuba where there is no available drinking water form taps and faucets. It was wonderful. It works like a french press for coffee and requires a little more pressure (we put it on the floor to use our body weight). We filled our reusable bottles (with the GRAYL water) from a variety of sources and it tasted great and we had no health issues. We purchased one or two bottles of water the entire trip so saved hundreds? It is a wonderful and healthy solution to purchasing bottled water. We recommend this product very highly and will always take one when we travel.
customer_reviews.author: Alice Forrester

customer_reviews.title: What a great idea...
customer_reviews.text: The Grayl water filtration bottles were HIGHLY recommended to us by a doctor at my local Veterans Administration Medical Center as part of our preparation for a pending month-long trip to several countries in Southeast Asia. As a result of his suggestion, I bought two of them for my wife and myself. Unfortunately we have not yet used them, so I can’t leave a meaningful review. If they live up to the hype, I’m sure we will be very happy. I will revisit this after the end of our trip.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Augeri

customer_reviews.title: BY FAR THE BEST WATER FILTER SOLUTION EVER!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, I have WAY too many water filters (just ask my wife). But I can honestly say the Grayl water filters are the absolute best water filters on the market. The ease of use, functionality, and durability beats all the others I have tried (Survivor Filter, Life Straw, Sawyer, etc.) We have used both the Grayl Ultralight and a GeoPress on global adventures (Northern Europe, Mediterranean, North and Central America) and these have performed flawlessly every time! I recently stocked up on some more filters because we plan to use these for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome idea and water, small drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Took this backpacking. It's awesome - Great filtering, convenient, but a bit heavy. The water tasted better than my other friend's Katydyn pump filters. My only criticism is about the amount of force needed to press the filter. I'm a big guy, so it's not an issue, but there's no way my wife could use it. When pressing the filter, the instructions say to loosen the cap a bit to relieve pressure. In doing so the cap will sometimes jump the threads if it's unscrewed too far, which makes me worry a bit about the longevity of the unit. Take an extra water container to fill from this one, and you'll be please.
customer_reviews.author: Discover

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing and getting everything out of the water
customer_reviews.text: This guy is beyond amazing. I live in a rural, tiny area with horrid water quality. The water literally comes out the tap rusty brown about once a year when they "flush the pipeline"... I do not drink the tap water, until I gott this bottle. The water is crystal clear after filtration and tastes amazing! And I feel so much better knowing the heavy metals, that have been tested and shown in my tap water, have been removed. Just be sure to remember to keep the lid unscrewed a bit as you press down the filter, I was confused on that the first time I tried and just made a mess.
customer_reviews.author: Moriah

customer_reviews.title: Great for purifying Mexican tap water
customer_reviews.text: My son was traveling to visit and stay with missionaries located in 4 cities in Mexico for the summer. I was unsure what the accommodations would be or what the water situation might be and I’m glad I purchased. Even the nicest homes he visited advised him that the tap water is not potable and though many buy bottled water for drinking, it was not always convenient for him to do so. This was perfect, as it allowed him to fill from tap water and and instantly purify it for drinking. He was able to use tap water as his primary drinking source using this bottle and could carry it with him. Didn’t get sick once. I’m a believer.
customer_reviews.author: Techie Working Mother

customer_reviews.title: Help save the environment and get one
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a water bottle with a filter to take around the world and not to have to buy plastic bottles of water. This fits the bill. Some have commented that it’s volume is on the low side. And I have to agree. I wish it were just a little bigger. Then again because of the filter it is already big enough - so it’s a balancing act. I have been happy with how it works. And it’s held up.
customer_reviews.author: KGS

customer_reviews.title: serious filtering
customer_reviews.text: I needed a filter water bottle for use on a cruise and for a trip to Europe (five countries). Though the flavor is not always as pleasant as my Berkey home filter, Grayl still does a great job with filtration, and I can drink water confidently in many locations. The chlorine taste is definitely subdued. It is a durable product with a good amount of filtered water available with each press but beware that it is a solid--not lightweight--piece of equipment and that a serious amount of pressure is needed to filter each time. I do wish that the bottle would keep liquids cold, but I can't have it all.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Best traveller's water filter.
customer_reviews.text: Better than filters you have to suck through, faster and easier than any other traveler's filter bottle. Not for suspect water, i.e. wilderness or third world travel, but for most domestic or European destinations, this thing really makes public water taste, well, like clean water. and its sooo easy! I keep it in my travel/carry-on bags everywhere I travel. I do bring the bigger filter when travelling where the water quality may be suspect, but still always carry this for the clean flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome travel filter, have used it for a couple years
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had any issues with it, can be tough to push down on, but not a real bother. Their tap water filter option is pretty awesome if you have a clean water source and you just want to remove metals and non-bacterial contaminants. Haven't used it hiking or climbing yet, seems like it would be good.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Did not improve water quality with before/after water testing
customer_reviews.text: I like the look in the style. However the filtration power is inferior. I ran tapwater through and there was no change in the water quality. I used a water tester and my tap water registered 49. I ran the water through this water purification bottle and it still registered at 49.
customer_reviews.author: Eye on quality

customer_reviews.title: Great product and very useful.
customer_reviews.text: This water purifier has been very useful during camping and bush walks. Very convenient and solid. Once closed properly there's no leak. At the beginning I thought the amount of purified water wasn't enough (almost 500ml) but after a month using it, it's actually it perfect. I definitely recommend this water purifier.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia D.

customer_reviews.title: Defective (or Not) or Worth Buying Is the Question?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product primarily for my trip to Asia in late June and in early August. I watched the installation videos and thought was pretty simple. I simply filled it with water to the fill line (maybe even less), but it was leaking as I pressed down. I didn't mind the seconds and effort that I filter the water, but I do mind leaking. I checked the cartridge and watched the video again. I never got it to work since I purchase this product. Now, I am passed the returned date and I have no idea what to do with this expensive product.
customer_reviews.author: Rowena

customer_reviews.title: This was amazing for an international trip that my family took
customer_reviews.text: This was amazing for an international trip that my family took! We had no issues with the water and loved the ease of this water bottle. It was great to be able to fill up several water bottles from this one bottle. It was easier than carrying around a larger filter or trying to use a filter straw. Our toddlers were not able to suck through a filter straw so this was a great option.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Ann Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Good, But Leaks
customer_reviews.text: It's been almost 2 months since I started used this bottle almost daily, and while it seems to work well by removing most of any expected tastes from hose or sink water, it unfortunately leaks. I store this in the top of my backpack sideways, and I've noticed the material of my bag getting wet from a small leak somewhere on the bottle---not a good long-term sign.
customer_reviews.author: Horanano

customer_reviews.title: Helps you reduce use of bottled water
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I had this thing when I was in Peru in a sketchy motel 3 years ago (which is also a scenario listed in its directions pamphlet). But I’m glad i had it for my trip to South Africa! I’m constantly trying to reduce my use of single plastics and that’s even harder when traveling. But this was nice to have to filter tap or well water on my trip. It did not leak and I jostled it around a lot. I look forward to taking it on more trips
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Beyond Excellent in China!!
customer_reviews.text: GRAYL water purifier far exceeded our travel expectations!! Trust this product it’s amazing! You want this one because you can either drink directly from the filter or pour into another container. We used this all over China with water marked do not drink and it performed beautifully no tummy troubles at all. For the money you will save buying bottled water - pony up a little extra cash for this superior product... you will be so thankful you did, we were!! You’ll be ready for emergency situations too - added bonus.
customer_reviews.author: Cha Cha Charley

customer_reviews.title: Not functional after 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: Used it on lake water in northern Ontario. All the lakes have stained but other wise clean water. The unit at first did an excellent job removing all water color and taste. However after 10 or so uses, the the resistance to plunge became so great that it was not usable. We were careful to use only surface water, avoiding any sediment.
customer_reviews.author: RW Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Bought for trip to Nepal. Ran out of bottled water on a hot day sight seeing and really needed a drink. Got water out of a ground faucet and put my trust in this purifier. Tasted good and I didn’t get sick. Used it on my trek also with good results. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Jakubczyk

customer_reviews.title: looked for a long time for a good water purifier
customer_reviews.text: looked for a long time for a good water purifier. this is one of the easiest I have come across to use. I also had sample of dirty Lake water tested at the local water dept. the sample came back good for drinking water. you don't get a whole lot of uses per filter, 40 I think but for the price its good for fishing trips and just to keep in the car for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: blaze2200

customer_reviews.title: I love it - BUT - It's a brick.
customer_reviews.text: I love it - BUT - It's a brick. I bought it to use on the Pacific Crest Trail. I used it for 4 days. It works as advertised and the other reviews touting ease of use are spot-on. HOWEVER - It's A Brick. It is HEAVY, when compared to other filter systems. One, sometimes has to make a choice between convenience and weight. In the end, I chose a much lighter system and left the GRAYL unit and a spare Purifier Cartridge in a "hiker box". It would be great for car camping or traveling, and I recommend it highly for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Not much water for that cost!
customer_reviews.text: Looks like it does the job but you only get like 1 glass of water. Filter takes too much space in the bottle and it is expensive for the size.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great travel filter!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, makes about 16 ounces of potable, protozoa free, virus free, heavy metals/chemicals free water in seconds. It doesn't take up much room in my pack... perhaps a bit more than some other products, but then other products aren't as quick and easy to use. During recent travels I found the water at my lodgings to be heavily chlorinated. A taste that I do not care for. I had my Grayl handy and decided to try an experiment and filtered the tap water with it. Guess what? No more chlorine taste!
customer_reviews.author: gary wood

customer_reviews.title: I was never unsure about being able to drink the lake water and it actually tasted really good!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this in the Boundary Waters and was very impressed with how clean it made the water. I was never unsure about being able to drink the lake water and it actually tasted really good!
customer_reviews.author: Michael R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Soldiers.
customer_reviews.text: My husband has a hard time staying hydrated. The municipal water sources where we are taste like pool water. Plus the water that comes out of the water buffalo smells and tastes like metal. Now he's able to fill up from any water source and the smell and taste are vastly improved. He's headed to the field soon and he will be taking his Grayl with him.
customer_reviews.author: K. Rocha

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This product is a MUST for travelers who venture into areas where the water may not be clean. Great to carry on hikes or back pack trips because you need not carry heavy bottles of water or canteens. Use any stream or water source. Originally purchased for hurricane supplies but have used it when traveling to hotels - no need to drink the tap water or buy expensive bottled water.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Kato

customer_reviews.title: Great Design, light weight, colorful, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: There are three parts of this drink cup, the outer cup(bright orange), inner cup (light orange with filter at bottom), and lid. Fill the bright orange drink glass with water you would like to clean, slide light orange filtered cup portion into the bright orange glass with the lid on. Push down on the light orange glass with lid as it slides into bright orange glass. When the inner glass has stopped sliding, the water under the lid is ready to drink. I watched a You Tube Video on the product and it explained it thoroughly.
customer_reviews.author: GEORGIA S.

customer_reviews.title: Great water... fast.  But only 40g worth
customer_reviews.text: Wow. The water from this is great. No taste and fast use, just as stated. Me with this and my bro with his life straw, I fill up my bladder in 2 min (ish). He was filling for 15 min. But... it is stated to be good for 40g where his Lifestraw is good for 100,000g. and it weighs more. But the water was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kathleen Cosca

customer_reviews.title: Terrific when traveling
customer_reviews.text: The orange Grayl Filter provided me with the reassurance that my water was drinkable when we traveled to Nepal and Tibet. Our tour guide provided us with bottled water, which probably is free of parasites, viruses and bacteria. I then filtered the bottled water as an added precaution. However, other reviewers have said it was unnecessary to drink bottled water when traveling, and that this filter is reliable enough to remove all nasties from contaminated tap water.
customer_reviews.author: Sample S.

customer_reviews.title: Ridiculous force and 5+ minutes to filter one bottle
customer_reviews.text: We bought this bottle for our water treatment up at the bwca. It took all of our body weight to press it down- hurting our hands to do so, and it took 5+ minutes because the filtration was so slow And took such immense forces We’re both fairly strong people too.This honestly put a huge damper on our trip and left us both super dehydrated as a result. I’d understand if the filtration took some time but the force required isn’t even possible for some people. I’m hoping we got a faulty item? Definitely returning.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Schomberg

customer_reviews.title: I like this. Used on my first trip
customer_reviews.text: I was able to make clean water so fast. Everyone else in my group was squeezing bags for 10 minutes. I would walk up, scoop up some water and push. I had clean water in seconds. Make sure it is lined up correctly as I was having an issue with the filter misaligned for a short bit. Otherwise very happy. Only downsize is this thing is heavy.
customer_reviews.author: AA-Ron

customer_reviews.title: Best water mate
customer_reviews.text: We took it with us to Twin Lakes. Stayed at Robinson Creek and they had just had a mudslide so the creek was brown. We tested the bottles there and the water turned out clear and delicious. We then took it on a 8 mile hike. This got us through our hike because we ran out of water and we were able to use these on the creeks we crossed on the way up and down. Excellent purchase and can't wait for another strenuous hike with these! Not to mention now we can save money and never have to worry about buying jugs or bottles of water and produce less trash! Ten star rating in my book! Yeah!
customer_reviews.author: Minidonutz

customer_reviews.title: clean water ever time
customer_reviews.text: This works for us. We hike the Sierras a couple of times a year. this filter makes carrying jugs of water a thing of the past (must be near a source of water). In seconds it if full of clean safe water with just the weight of your upper body. You can use it when in an area that has questionable tap water also. It should have a spout so you don't have to open it every time you get a drink is the only down side. Filter is replaceable.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Great option for international travel
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a week+ trip to southern India, filtered everything, even some of the bottled water (micro particles and mold release). Worked great, did not suffer any water-related illness. Force needed is minor. I saw a recommendation to carry this and another bottle to 'stock-up', and I did that and liked it. This did not leak through airplane altitude changes, but I was concerned every time, so started emptying prior to flights. Overall, very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Nunya

customer_reviews.title: this purifier was perfect. It worked well
customer_reviews.text: On my 4-day trek to Machu Picchu, this purifier was perfect. It worked well, was easy to use, and gave me fresh and clean drinking water to quench my thirst from hours and hours of hiking. Really, it couldn't get any better. If you're looking for a water purifier to save you from potential stomach aches, getting seriously ill, diarrhea, or all of the above, this purifier is what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Christina V

customer_reviews.title: Still working great to this day i actually used this to Drink ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this at a festival as i knew it was going to have way sub par water being out in the middle of nowhere and i was not about to spend 5 bucks a bottle for water. Still working great to this day i actually used this to Drink the ice cold melting water that was in my cooler over the 5 day camping weekend and it was great as soon as the filter is spent on this i will definitely be buying a replacement pack of filters
customer_reviews.author: Tj T.

customer_reviews.title: drinking water
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item in preparation to go backpacking. I wanted something that was light weight as well as a product that would get rid of the gunk from the water I'd be drinking from the streams. This product was just that... it cleaned the dirty stuff out and allowed me to feel safe drinking water that was purified. I like how the product filters through the water and doesn't just kill the bacteria and leave it in there. Good product, I've used it many times since purchasing, would recommend to anyone wanting one for hiking/backpacking/traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Howard

customer_reviews.title: Perfect water bottle with a great filter for easy travel.
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these for myself and another for my dad with a few international trips in mind. The bottle is easy to use. You water is clean and fresh tasting. It’s a normal water bottle size, so it’s easy to fit into the side pockets of a backpack. The high level of filtration is done quickly and easily. It gives you some extra peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Christianna R.

customer_reviews.title: Compact and does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Love the compact power of this water bottle. It’s lightweight and can filter about 2.5 cups at a time roughly. I’ll be using this for cooking and drinking. Using it for freshwater streams only at this point. So far seems to work well and will follow up!
customer_reviews.author: LKS1989

customer_reviews.title: Loved it until it was stolen
customer_reviews.text: I loved my GRAYL Ultralight Water Purifier! It came in handy when I needed it the most- traveling outside of the US. On my second day after returning to the states, I had forgotten my GRAYL Ultralight Water Purifier and my Lyft driver wouldn't dare return it, despite after offering payment to have it returned. I chose GRAYL Ultralight Water Purifier after reading the comments and it was worth every penny. My only frustration was thinking my Lyft driver would be decent enough to return something she had no use of. Great product overall.
customer_reviews.author: Alma Beaty

customer_reviews.title: Ease to use and filters bacteria, viruses and some heavy metals
customer_reviews.text: I took this to PR on my disaster relief trip. I used it to filter tap water since the quality was questionable. It tastes good and I never had problems. I demonstrated it to a group of people at a church and they liked it also. The size fits easily on the bottle pocket of my backpack and I would leave the filter out over night to get it to dry. I will always carry this anywhere water quality or availability is in question.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Works Awesome! (Crack the seal before filtering)
customer_reviews.text: Took this to India. It was great. Filtered all the tap water (and even some bottled) that I drank. Some say it's hard to press. (Maybe they forgot to twist the lid open a quarter to half a turn?) It does take a little work. But it's not that hard. I highly recommend this for travel or camping or survival gear.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D Phillips

customer_reviews.title: A necessity!
customer_reviews.text: wow.. I love this, such an amazing water purifier. I made a video of my first use, and since that day I have taken this bad boy everywhere with me. I take it hiking, camping, biking, kayaking, traveling in country and out... basically on my person everyday. I have the orange filter for dirty water and the blue for questionable tap water.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Good for travel
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 6 months of international travel and used it many times when boiled water was not available. Never had to use it on water from a stream/outdoors; only used it for tap water. The filter is somewhat hard to push down even when it is fairly new, but I never got sick after drinking the water I filtered with it. The filter cylinder has to be in the bottle for the cap to fit, so you cannot use the bottle without the filter cylinder in it. I attached a clip to the top to make it easier to latch onto my backpack. Will keep using and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GRAYL replaced my bottled water habit
customer_reviews.text: This product screams quality with the durable housing made of nearly unbreakable plastic. The filter worked so much better than I expected based on previous experiences from similar products on the market. The taste was so nice, I like smoother water coming from bottled. This holds up next to those companies with this super effective filter. The press is similar to french press coffee. Worth the work, and even more satisfying after taking a sip! I can say you can trust this product fully, I am super impressed and can save on bottle usage ;)
customer_reviews.author: TULE

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Easy to Carry
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 21 mile hike immediately after receiving. This worked great for pulling water out of streams and purifying for drinking. I was able to use to refill my bladder and have enough water for the long day. Lightweight and convenient water purification option for backpacking gear.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Ciocco

customer_reviews.title: Can filter for multiple people and then use regular carry bottles!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a mission trip to Africa, worked great! Was able to filter the water and then pour into other drinking vessels and add flavor drops, green tea packets etc! Was able to do several glasses in a row to prepare for more than one person before each day! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Pat S.

customer_reviews.title: All in one unit makes it easy to pack in and out on a hike.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the product is all in ONE design which makes it easy to carry plus use. The filter worked the water tasked great and I did not get ill later. On a recent hike I got off the trial and ran out of water in my backpack however found a very small stream used the product got 32 oz. water and filled up a bottle so I could make it out safely. The only concern I have is pushing the water through the filter takes a lot of effort and if I was injured or weak I would not be able to do it. I am 6'2" 220?
customer_reviews.author: kmjteaitup

customer_reviews.title: Causes pin in hands
customer_reviews.text: After using this one, I’d splurge for the bigger version. Not because it’s bigger but because you put a lot of pressure on your hands and the bigger one has special places for your hands to go to release the pressure and minimize pain. This versions puts huge grooves in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: River

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly and kept our water supply clean.
customer_reviews.text: Once we learned how to use it, it was a snap to fill and keep clean. Used it for our travel to one of the developing countries, where we were cautioned not to drink the water. Saved on having to buy bottled water so paid for itslef in the long run. Never had any illnesses or stomach problems unlike some of our fellow traveling companions.
customer_reviews.author: Edi

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product. It works well and very compact
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. It works well and very compact. It has a great built quality and replaceable filter. It is recommended that you use this while on the ground and use your weight to push down to filter. I found it was not necessary to do this. It does take some force with the highest quality filter (orange), but I found it to be manageable. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: ArnellTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Tap water in rural India.. sure bring it on
customer_reviews.text: Have had to travel to India few times a year in last couple of years which included going to places where getting bottled water you can trust is a big concern. After my research I found this holy Grayl. This is a real lifesaver. Took the orange filter on my trips. I trusted getting regular tap water and using this filter than using bottled water in many places in India. This filter has been a constant companion on wherever I traveled there.
customer_reviews.author: whereismySelf

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work but a bit painful to use
customer_reviews.text: I filter lousy tasting tap water and it helps. It is hard on your hands - takes a lot of force while you press on the thin rim of the cup. Feels like it could give you soft tissue injury on your hands if you use it used too often. I will have to find a flat piece of wood or something to lean on the top of the cup so my hands are nor pressing on the rim. Have not tried it yet with anything but tap water.
customer_reviews.author: bob a.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a trip with me to Asia. Didn't trust the bottled water there so used it on a daily basis. Really easy to use. A bit heavy but not much. Easily manageable. I added a clip to it and would just clip it to my jeans when walking around. First time I didn't get sick traveling overseas. Would recommend to anyone looking for a quick way to filter water!
customer_reviews.author: A A

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I went to China. He has just had sinus surgery the month before and needed very pure water to flush his sinus with, so I bought him the Grayl. It is easy to use, the water tasted good and he was able to use it for medical reasons with confidence about the quality and purity of the water. We will travel with it from now on.
customer_reviews.author: A. Walls

customer_reviews.title: Nice to have something to take on trips
customer_reviews.text: Nice to have something to take on trips, but it is definitely hard to push the water through the filter. I like that it doesn't have any extra pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy solution for filtering water on the go
customer_reviews.text: We have used this bottle several times on hikes in the Rocky Mtns over the past two months. No ones gotten sick yet! It’s lightweight and simple to use. We bring it empty and use it to refill our water bladders or bottles throughout the day. Be aware that the filter needs to completely dry out before storing.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: I’m not dead yet
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell you I walked and hiked and camped my butt off to test this and I will back this. It does what you need it to do if you find any body of water . Remember it does not work in saltwater, or brackish. But running freshwater will work perfect.
customer_reviews.author: eric

customer_reviews.title: Not a good value
customer_reviews.text: The instructions say to fill with water, place on the ground and push down on the lid. I did all that but did not notice any difference. I was afraid to drink the water. Just wish I got back in time to return it
customer_reviews.author: Suzie

customer_reviews.title: Handles swamp water
customer_reviews.text: This used for hunting in the swamps of southeast Louisiana and it's excellent. It filters the nastiest swamp water over and over again and has changed the way we pack. When running after hog dogs or humping it through bayous and bottom lands it hasn't let us down once. It freaks the other guys out and they think were crazy for drinking swamp water. I wish it were easier to press down but it's a suitable trade off for convience.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan Storey

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I went on a European trip and a trip to Disney. I love this water filtering water bottle. The water tasted great and at Disney, I didn't have to pay $3 for the plastic water bottle every time I was thirsty. I read that some people thought it was hard to use. So I watched the YouTube video to learn how to use it. I thought it was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Julez

customer_reviews.title: Works!
customer_reviews.text: A bit difficult to filter water through- you need to press very hard. But it works really well. I used this in Cuba to filter boiled water that had that a weird taste. Removed the taste almost completely. Plan to use for camping and hiking.
customer_reviews.author: IMHO

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Used it for 4 people in Banff National Park for 10 days. No problems. It fell off my saddle twice and bounced down rocky inclines. Used a piece of paracord through handle in lid to tie to saddle. Filled it from streams and river and no one was sick.
customer_reviews.author: Patcake

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: This purifier was invaluable on my recent three day backpacking trip on the Appalachian Trail. We were able to fill 8 - 10 liters of reservoirs and bottles among our party of 3 in just a few minutes. Even with barely trickling water sources we were able to efficiently refill. So much better that a straw at a time or waiting 30 minutes for purifying tablets! Excellent product and well built!
customer_reviews.author: Alex Durham

customer_reviews.title: Beyond happy with this.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry and pack does get a bit challenging after afew uses but I’m very happy with this. I do wish I was able to keep my water cold but just to be able to use creek or lake water during my hikes or being on my SUP this is a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Tru

customer_reviews.title: Used this while traveling in Bolivia for 3 weeks. ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this while traveling in Bolivia for 3 weeks. The only time I got sick was when I accidentally drank unfiltered water that was used in a lemonade I bought. So thankfully I had this with me in La Paz, Tarija, and Santa Cruz or who knows what would have happened!
customer_reviews.author: Kendall

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I overall really like this bottle for traveling, however, it is a bit bulky (compared to a Lifestraw) so you have to clip on to your bag etc. But it is nice having a full container of clean water, so it is more convenient in that way.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M

customer_reviews.title: water tastes great
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, just as indicated in description and video. Yes, it takes some exertion to push, but using your body weight is easy (I'm 65 and no body-builder!). Note that the more you use murky water in this, the faster your filter will need to be replaced. I just used it to filter local city water that was suspect during my travels. Very sturdy. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: It leaks
customer_reviews.text: I just finished a 17 day volunteer trip in Thailand. Sadly I hated this bottle. It leaked all over my bag, not once. But twice. I was using it properly, made sure I pushed it all the way in until it was sealed. Only ever filled it to the fill line. Still, leaked everywhere. I was sort of disappointed because I could’ve just brought my regular swell bottle and a life straw.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Machado

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly great and useful water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly great and useful water bottle. Before my 2 month backpacking trip I gave customer service a call and they answered all the questions I needed and they were super helpful. I used this in South and Central America for drinking from the tap water and it worker perfectly. Would recommend this 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: GRAYL Ultralight Water Purifier [+ Filter] Bottle
feature_bullets: COMPACT: 16 oz. purifier bottle makes safe, clean drinking water from virtually any freshwater source
FAST AND EASY-TO-USE - Ideal for international travelers, hikers, and emergency prep kits
REMOVES WATERBORNE PATHOGENS (e.g. Hepatitis A, Norovirus, Rotavirus); Bacteria (e.g. E. coli, Salmonella, Cholera); and Protozoan Cysts (e.g. Giardia, Cryptosporidium)
AWARD WINNING [OnePress] design — Just Fill from any sketchy freshwater source, then Press on a low surface (e.g. ground), then Drink safe water, anywhere
FILTERS particulates (e.g. sediment, silt), many chemicals (e.g. chlorine, benzene) and heavy metals (e.g. lead, arsenic); zero aftertaste, eliminates bad odors, improves clarity and flavor

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
